item.description:
The weather looks ok for a north shore ride on Saturday with several great coastal sections.

Route Summary:
38.5 mile ride, starting out in Manchester By The Sea MBTA station.

We will head out to Cape Ann and pass thru Gloucester and Rockport. There are several scenic stopping points so having walkable bike shoes is a good idea. Also, bring layers, and gloves (coastal wind can be cold on hands)

The length of this ride puts this in the intermediate category.

The route
http://goo.gl/maps/BPDpr

Riders should plan to meet at 10:30 am and be ready to ride @ 10:45 am.

We should return to the parking area around 3:30 pm if we can keep the 12 plus pace. Please be able to b/c the group needs to return on time to the parking area.


Starting point
MBTA station, Manchester by the Sea

(rear parking area past main plaza with Dunkin Donuts)

40 Beach St Manchester, MA 01944

Midway point

Rockport, MA (beakskin neck area)

http://www.beanandleafcafe.net/

What's required
------------------------------------
Bike helmets and road bikes / skinny tire hybrids in good repair, cool weather riding gear, water and snacks


What's recommended:
------------------------------------
Bike shoes, Spare tire, repair kit, sun screen, snacks, energy bars, rain gear, an extra layer, a bike lock, and a cell phone.

 

Cue"gle" cue sheet

http://files.meetup.com/482869/capeann.txt
item.how_to_find_us: MBTA Parking is in the very back area past Plaza with Dunkin Donuts
item.name: Manchester by the Sea to Cape Ann
